item.title: Religion
item.description:
Phases in Ossetia

    1. An original Scythian Paganism;
    1. a first wave of Christianisation under Byzantine and Georgian influence from the tenth to the thirteenth century (partial elite conversion);
    1. a “re-Paganization” during the fourteenth and fifteenth century following the Mongol invasions and the disruption of the contacts with the Byzantines;
    1. a partial re-Christianisation during the sixteenth and seventeenth century conducted by Georgian missionaries;
    1. a further re-Christianisation conducted by Russian missionaries beginning in the late eighteenth century;
    1. enforced state atheism during the Soviet Union from 1921 to 1991; and
    1. a resurgence of “traditional Ossetian religion” since the 1980sâ€“1990s.
